CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 4, 1957, pg. A15, reads: "WIN ORCHIDS - Prize winners for their charming hats at the Alpha Wives' bridge luncheon at Kaufman's [sic] were these lovely ladies. Mrs. Hazel Betters White, third; Mrs. Kathryn Wilson, Cheyney, Pa., first, and Mrs. Ethel Holland, second.  Mrs. Alice Parr pins a double orchid (from Harold's) on the first-prize winner. - Harris Photo." Article reads: "Alpha Wives Luncheon is Brilliant - The Alpha Wives' bridge luncheon at Kaufmann's proved to be a smart affair.  The 150 women were a picture of spring.  Orchids for the prettiest hats went to Mrs. Kathryn Wilson, Cheyney State Teachers College professor, first; second to Mrs. Ethel Holland, who wore a small beige head-hugging creation, and third to Mrs. Hazel Betters White for a large beige-flowered cartwheel.  Mrs. Wilson's hat was a large Chinese coolie type completely covered with tiny flowers of pink, blue and lavender.  Bridge prizes went to Mrs. Lucille Cuthbert, Mrs. Doris Griffin, Mrs. Nan Lewis and Mrs. Jewel Blow.  Pinochle winner was Mrs. Dorothea Mason, and whist, Mrs. Elizabeth Gentry.  Door prize went to Mrs. Catherine Roberts.  Chairman for the affair were Mrs. Lola Givens and Mrs. R. L. Vann."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of four women, including Alice Parr pinning double orchid corsage on Kathryn Wilson for her first place winning hat, Hazel Betters White on left, and Ethel Holland second from right, at Alpha Wives bridge luncheon at Kaufmanns, another version
